results.title: Tectonics
results.creator_credit: Ian Rosenbloom, European Broadcasting Union and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Planet Earth”.
Program 1 of a 4 part series. Each program is divided into sections for easy classroom viewing using a combination of the latest computer graphics and filmed examples of climatic occurrences to provide a detailed description and explanation of the geographical factors influencing Planet Earth. This video aims to provide a detailed description and explanation of the structure of the earth; plate tectonics; earthquakes at destructive and conservative margins; collision zones; fold mountains; and volcanoes. Includes a teacher’s guide.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Rosenbloom, European Broadcasting Union and Yorkshire Television

results.title: Tea with Mussolini
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Clive Parsons, Giovanella Zannoni, Riccardo Tozzi, Cattleya, Cineritmo, G2, Medusa Film and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Loosely based on his childhood, Zeffirelli weaves this enchanting tale with a gentle, loving hand. It is the story of a diverse group of cultured ladies, living in Florence in 1934, who meet for tea each afternoon. The group includes Lady Random (Maggie Smith), widow of the British ambassador to Italy, Arabella (Judy Dench) an artist and singer, Georgie (Lily Tomlin), an exuberant American archaeologist, and the brash and uninhibited Elsa (Cher). One of the ladies, Mary (Joan Plowright), becomes a surrogate mother to a young boy, Luca, and he is soon virtually adopted and brought up by the group. As Luca grows to become a man, the shifting political climate begins to have a devastating impact on the rarified world in which the ladies exist, and they must come to terms not only with their own mortality but also the inescapable passage of time.

results.title: Australian Capital Territory
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Australia’s capital city, although relatively young, offers a range of cultural, historical and natural attractions. Enjoy panoramic views of Canberra from a hot air balloon, a ride into Snowy River country, a 4WD adventure through the ACT or a coach tour to the War Memorial, the National Film and Sound Archive, Parliament House or the National Art Gallery.

results.title: Teen suicide
results.creator_credit: Kyle Boyd, Charlotte Angel, Matt Clark and Cambridge Research Group Limited
results.brief_description: This program looks at the reasons troubled teenagers consider, attempt or commit suicide. There is an emphasis on recognising the warning signs, the importance of communication, preventative measures and where to go to help. The program features interviews with teenagers who offer insights into the reasons why they felt suicidal and how they dealt with their situations.

results.title: New South Wales
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Enjoy the tranquil beauty of Myall Lakes, experience a journey on the Zig Zag railway aboard a steam locomotion, tour Fort Denison or take an alpine escape to the Snowy Mountains, view the spectacular rugged coastline at Murramarang, cruise Sydney Harbour on a replica of the ‘Bounty’, stargaze in the Warrumbungles, visit the Blue Mountains, sample the local product at the Pepper Tree vineyard in the Hunter Valley - the cradle of Australian wine making and complete your New South Wales tour with a 9 day marathon bike road tour.

results.title: South Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Visit the rich, fertile Barossa Valley, trek into the outback, enjoy the spectacular view from Mt Lofty House in the Adelaide Hills beautifully restored after the 1983 Ash Wednesday bush fires, visit the Gawler Ranges and the seaside town of Victor Harbour, charter a yacht at Port Lincoln, explore the heritage buildings in the mining town of Burra, journey by train from Adelaide to Alice Springs on the legendary Ghan, stay in an underground hotel in the opal mining town of Coober Pedy and finally enjoy a boat trip at Coorong.

results.title: It feels like you're left out of the world: experiencing learning disabilities
results.creator_credit: Barrie Angus McLean, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Learning Series”.
Children speak of their attitudes towards their own learning disabilities, and of the way in which their life has been affected by these disabilities. Articulates the personal and social consequences of having a learning problem - the feeling of being a failure is a classroom lesson that many of these children never forget. Shows that the children given time and special help, their problems can be overcome.

results.title: Queensland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Beginning with Brisbane’s elegant houses, this Queensland travel video also moves inland and along the expansive coastline. Enjoy the recreational activities on Hamilton Island, join a backpack tour that includes scuba diving, bush walking and horse riding, experience the Stockman’s Hall of Fame and the waterhole which inspired the Waltzing Matilda legend, visit the beaches of Surfer’s Paradise and Noosa, kayak in the Daintree Forest or sail to tranquil locations in the Whitsuday Islands.

results.title: On the Road to Survival
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Jack Absalom’s outback Australia series”.
Survival, says Jack Absalom, is a matter of commonsense and preparedness. In this film he demonstrates the techniques for safe travel that he has developed in his many years in the Outback. The program recreates a simple vehicle breakdown and highlights the potential for a tragedy. Rated: PG
